intro: Betonica valdepubens, commonly known as the rough betony, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family, characterized by its hairy stems and blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in moist meadows and woodland edges, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are clustered in whorls along the stem. Betonica valdepubens is often used in traditional herbal medicine for its purported calming and digestive properties.
